DataElement.preferredName: Unique Device Identifier For a Patient's Implantable Device
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The universal identification for the implanted medical device supplied to the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Implanted Medical Device Unit of Use Device Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A status indicating that a device is placed into a surgically or naturally formed cavity of the human body._An identifier assigned to associate the use of a device on a patient. This is for use when a UDI is not assigned to the individual device at the level of its Unit of Use. For example, a Unit of Use DI would be assigned to an individual electrode when the electrode is distributed in a package of 10.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A status indicating that a device is placed into a surgically or naturally formed cavity of the human body.

Concepts.definition: A finding referring to a medical device that has been placed in the body, usually during a surgical procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: An identifier assigned to associate the use of a device on a patient. This is for use when a UDI is not assigned to the individual device at the level of its Unit of Use. For example, a Unit of Use DI would be assigned to an individual electrode when the electrode is distributed in a package of 10.

Concepts.definition: An identifier to associate the use of device on a patient when the Universal Device Identifier is applied to a package of multiple devices.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set - 45 CFR 170.102
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support ONC CCDS project_ghd
